metadata.title: CVE-2020-0465 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In various methods of hid-multitouch.c, there is a possible out of boundswrite due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-162844689References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0465` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-193-generic - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-193-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-193-lowlatency - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-193-generic - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-193-lowlatency - 4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1081-aws - 4.4.0-1081.85
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-azure - 4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-193.224~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1081.85').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1').
